DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate safety administration copper chelate agent , tetrathiomolybdate , patient idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis fail previous treatment . The primary endpoint study safety secondary endpoint include change pulmonary function , exercise capacity , quality life .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Study Tetrathiomolybdate Patients With Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis Disease progression despite six month treatment ( steroid with/without azathioprine cyclophosphamide ) define least one following : Increased symptom Decline force vital capacity least 10 % Decline diffusion capacity carbon monoxide least 20 % Increased infiltrate CXR high resolution CT scan Taking < 15 mg prednisone least 30 day prior screen Age 3580 , inclusive Able understand write informed consent comply study protocol Significant environmental exposure Diagnosis collagen vascular disease Evidence active infection Clinically significant cardiac disease : Myocardial infarction , coronary artery bypass angioplasty within 6mo Unstable angina pectoris Congestive heart failure require hospitalization within 6 month Uncontrolled arrhythmia Poorly control severe diabetes mellitus Pregnancy lactation Women childbearing potential use medically approve mean contraception ( i.e . oral contraceptive , intrauterine device , diaphragm , Norplant ) Current enrollment another experimental protocol Physiologic Criteria : FEV1/FVC < 0.60 Laboratory Criteria : Total bilirubin > 1.5 X upper limit normal AST ALT > 3X upper limit normal Alkaline phosphatase > 3X upper limit normal White blood cell count < 2,500/mm3 Hematocrit < 30 % Platelets < 100,000/mm3 Prothrombin time INR > 1.5
